title: Ranil admitted to prison hospital
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe, who was remanded until August 26 by Colombo Fort Magistrate Nilupuli Lankapura yesterday (22), has been admitted to the prison hospital.

title: Parliament’s High Post halts Govt’s nominee to a diplomatic post for second time
byline: In a development that exposes a grave breach of public trust and accountability, Parliament’s High Posts Committee, for the second time, has halted the nomination of H.M.V.B. Vijitha Herath to a diplomatic position, following a series of severe and well-documented allegations involving falsification of official records, unlawful possession of an Official Passport and misrepresentation of citizenship status.

title: Lankan charged with murder after SL woman found dead in UK
byline: A 37-year-old Sri Lankan man has been charged with murder after a Sri Lankan woman was found dead in a Cardiff street

title: Coal company chairman cannot escape probe by resigning: FLSP
byline: An immediate investigation must be launched into the chairman of the opposition-linked coal company, as he cannot be absolved of responsibility merely by resigning from his post, Education Secretary of the Front Line Socialist Party (FLSP) Pubudu Jayagoda said.

title: Train services cancelled and rescheduled due to coastal line maintenance
byline: Several train services have been cancelled and rescheduled today ( 23) and tomorrow (24) owing to essential maintenance work on the Coastal Railway Line, the General Manager of Railways, Ravindra Pathmapriya said.

title: UK and Sri Lanka finalise debt restructuring deal worth nearly US $ 90mn
byline: The governments of Sri Lanka and the United Kingdom have officially entered into a bilateral agreement to restructure a portion of Sri Lanka’s external debt, a deal valued at nearly US $ 90 million.

title: Sri Lanka’s first online platform for health and wellness education launched
byline: ‘Doc Talk’ - Experts Insights for Wellness, an all-new YouTube platform dedicated to providing health information was recently launched in a bid to open the doors to a new era in Sri Lanka’s wellness landscape.

title: Sajith Premadasa visits former President Ranil at Prison Hospital
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa today (23) visited former President Ranil Wickremesinghe at the Prison Hospital, a day after Wickremesinghe was remanded.

title: Legal fraternity condemns YouTubers’s prediction on former President’s arrest
byline: The legal community strongly criticized and condemned comments made by YouTuber Sudantha Thilakasiri, popularly known as “Sudaa,” regarding the possible arrest and remanding of former President Ranil Wickremesinghe, describing the remarks as an affront to the country’s judicial system and law enforcement authorities.

title: Sri Lanka’s presidency at risk: Lihini Fernando
byline: Moratuwa Municipal Councillor of the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB), Lihini Fernando, has warned that the arrest of former President Ranil Wickremesinghe sets a “dangerous precedent” for the office of the presidency in Sri Lanka.

title: Mahinda Rajapaksa visits Ranil at Prison Hospital
byline: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa visited former President Ranil Wickremesinghe at the Prison Hospital today (23).

title: Third party has interfered into enforcement of rule of law: Sajith
byline: A third party has interfered into the enforcement of the rule of law, Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa said today.

title: Real face of present administration uncovered: Ranil
byline: The real face of the present administration has been uncovered today, former President Ranil Wickremesinghe was heard saying minutes before he was arrested on Friday.

title: Ranil transferred to National Hospital
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe, who is in remand custody, has been transferred to the National Hospital in Colombo due to health concerns.

title: MR condemns Ranil’s imprisonment as political revenge
byline: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa today expressed his disappointment over the imprisonment of former President Ranil Wickremesinghe, describing it as an act of political revenge.

title: Former President Ranil’s condition remains unstable at Prison Hospital
byline: The medical condition of former President Ranil Wickremesinghe, who was admitted to the prison hospital last night (22) following a remand order, is reported to have remained unstable.

title: Joint Opposition vows to fight for Ranil Wickremesinghe’s release
byline: Senior leaders of the United National Party (UNP) have called for a united opposition campaign to secure the release of former President Ranil Wickremesinghe, who was remanded by the Fort Magistrate’s Court till August 26.
